content: checkerboard toque size adult small/medium designed by kristina k miller revised january 7 2025 checkerboard is a traditional pattern from maine and the canadian maritime provinces materials  145 yards total divided between 2 skeins of medium weight worsted weight #4 yarn in color s of your choice photo samples made with lion brand wool-ease 3 oz 197 yard skeins in colors riverside 009 and natural heather 098  circular needles #5 3 75mm in 24 length or less circular and double pointed needles dpn size #8 5 0mm  1 knitting needle marker to mark beginning of round and 5 markers in a different color for decrease sequence  optional pompom maker or faux fur pompom a button is also a nice finishing touch gauge on #8 needles in unblocked stockinette pattern 18 st = 4 24 row = 4 gauge on #8 in checkerboard pattern 24 st = 4 22 row = 4 glossary for abbreviations at end of pattern the pattern is worked in the round from bottom to top ribbing with the mc yarn provisionally cast on 90 sts using method of your choice my favorite is https //www youtube com/watch v=3ogg0aij3xe using smaller circular needle #5 knit one row being careful not to twist stitches place marker for beginning of row bor and then join to knit in the round on the next row begin the ribbing pattern using *k2 p1* around for 3 75 -4 joining folded brim place the 90 provisionally cast on sts onto another circular needle fold the right side out align the two needles and then knit the two paired stitches together from both of the two needles held together repeat all the way around to create the folded brim that is knitted together main body change to #8 circular needle and knit 1 row around while simultaneously increasing by 6 sts evenly around using a kf/b on every 15th st 96 sts this is a relaxed knit knit it too tight and corn row will appear plus it will be a smaller fit attach cc yarn and start checkerboard pattern below i recommend you switch the yarns in a row using an over under technique as that will minimize tangling to do this always bring the mc yarn forward on top over the cc yarn and bring the cc color forward from below under the mc yarn also do not knit this pattern too tightly allow for a reasonable amount of ease row 1 & 2 *k2 mc k2 cc* repeat around 24 times to bor slip bor row 3 & 4 *k2 cc k2 mc* repeat around 24 times to bor slip bor repeat these 4 row until hat measures 5 ½ or desired length from brim edge ending with a row 4 for me this worked out to 16 pattern row or eight 2-row stripes finishing with a row 4 proceed to crown decrease all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2024kristina k miller intended
